lead_paragraph: For the last seven and a half years, Dale Carlson looked for fraud and mismanagement in state agency budgets. But this week Mr. Carlson was looking for work. A staff auditor with California's Office of the Auditor General, Mr. Carlson and his 94 colleagues received layoff notices last month after California voters soundly defeated a ballot measure that would have restored financing to the Auditor General. The office closed on Friday after 37 years of keeping an eye on state government.
